project.name: Atlas Mobile
project.scope: Cross-platform app, feature flags, offline sync

sections.title: Project Context & UX Vision
sections.goal: Understand the UX Lead's perspective on Atlas Mobile's pilot phase goals, constraints, and how the design system supports them.
sample_questions: Can you describe the primary user personas identified for Atlas Mobile and how they influenced early design decisions?
How does the DS-ATLAS v2 Tokenized Components artifact align with our mission of sustainable velocity?
What constraints from the Pilot phase most impact your UX strategy?

sections.title: Accessibility & Research Integration
sections.goal: Probe how accessibility standards and research insights are integrated into the cross-platform design, especially under regulatory constraints.
sample_questions: What accessibility benchmarks are you targeting, and how do you measure compliance?
Can you give an example where user research directly altered a component specification?
How do you reconcile conflicting findings from mobile vs. desktop research when defining cross-platform patterns?

sections.title: Offline Sync & Feature Flags Impact
sections.goal: Examine the UX implications of offline sync and feature flag toggles, including failure modes and user trust.
sample_questions: How have you addressed potential confusion when features appear/disappear due to flag changes?
In offline mode, what UX patterns ensure data consistency and user awareness?
Can you walk me through a specific usability test scenario for offline conflict resolution?

sections.title: Cross-Department Collaboration
sections.goal: Explore how UX decisions interact with Platform, SRE, and QA requirements, especially regarding RB-MOB-021 Crash Loop Mitigation.
sample_questions: How did the Crash Loop Mitigation runbook inform your error state designs?
What trade-offs arose between SRE's stability requirements and UX responsiveness?
How do you ensure QA can trace UX-related defects back to design artifacts?

sections.title: Evidence-Based Decision Making
sections.goal: Assess how the UX Lead applies 'Evidence over Hype' in prioritizing design changes for the pilot.
sample_questions: Can you describe a time when qualitative research overrode a stakeholder's high-priority request?
How do you balance analytics data with anecdotal feedback?
What metrics are you tracking to decide whether a UX pattern graduates from pilot to scale?

sections.title: Risk Assessment & Future Scaling
sections.goal: Understand potential risks in scaling Atlas Mobile UX and how they are mitigated.
sample_questions: What are the most significant UX risks if we scale without further pilot iterations?
How do you plan to maintain design system integrity as more teams contribute?
What contingency plans exist if accessibility compliance slips during scale-up?
